tool.name: DirectionalSlope

param.name: demInput
param.dialogReference: The raster dataset or mosaic dataset that represents elevation values from which directional slopes will be derived. Elevation raster can represent ground elevations or plane of array elevations.
param.pythonReference: Raster should be in a projected coordinate system, preferably State Plane or UTM. Vertical units for the raster much match the horizontal units of the projection.

param.name: xyzUnit
param.dialogReference: Identifies the vertical units of the Input elevation raster (Foot or Meter). Vertical units for the raster much match the horizontal units of the projection.

param.name: slopeUnits
param.dialogReference: Defines the units of the slope output: percent, degrees, or radians. Default: Percent. Positive values: north or east, negative values: south or west.

param.name: outPut_options
param.dialogReference: Allows for the option to only output the north-south or east-west slopes, or to output both rasters

param.name: ewDS
param.displayname: East/west directional slope raster output dataset
param.dialogReference: Output raster dataset for the east-west slope raster
param.pythonReference: Must not have spaces, dashes, or unique characters.

param.name: nsDS
param.displayname: North/south directional slope raster output dataset
param.dialogReference: Output raster dataset for the north-south slope raster
param.pythonReference: Must not have spaces, dashes, or unique characters.

tool.summary: Derives the slope of an elevation raster in the cardinal directions (east, west, north, and south)
tool.usage: This tool allows you to visualize and analyze the slope of an elevation raster dataset. Outputs are two rasters: east-west and north-south. Slope can be expressed as percent, degrees, or radians. For the north-south raster, north is positive, and south is negative. For the east-west raster, east is positive, and west is negative.
